ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about various epigenetic marks and their role in disease and development.
a deep understanding of epigenetics and how it works: histone modifications, dna methylation, nucleosome structure, types of chromatin, reprogramming, development, & inheritance
I learned a lot about Epigenetics and concepts related to it. I also gained skills in reading and analyzing scientific papers and making scientific presentations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The weekly format included paper discussion sections on Wednesdays and lectures on Friday. Since lectures generally present a higher stress environment, I think it would be better to have them on Wednesday followed by paper discussion on Friday.

strengths: topics were SO INTERESTING. WOW. professors are experts in their fields. absolutely loved the lectures. the video assignment was also AWESOME. I would do more of those.
weaknesses: there were soooo many papers & discussions... I didn't get THAT much from them. Yes, it was useful and interesting to see what was being published in the field, what was cutting edge research. Did we have to spend so long talking about them and analyzing them in depth? Meh... I wish it was more lecture based honestly. The lectures moved quite fast and I loved listening / asking questions. There was even a few times when we finished early - I would have honestly had even more content.
The professors are very good at teaching, and the course content is very interesting.

The strength of this course was the teaching team! Professor Wolfswinkel, Professor Jacob, and our TA were all incredible and provided a lot of help throughout the class. They held review sessions, office hours, and meetings to review papers for projects. They were also always available to answer any questions. Also, the class's content was incredibly interesting as well and it was well taught! In terms of weaknesses, the course didn't really have any that I can think of.  The class was very enjoyable and as long as you put in effort into the course, you'll see results.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another biology student interested in learning more about epigenetics.
YES!! It's super super interesting, not that much work at all, and the professors are great. The quizzes are HARD though, you have to put in the work to study.
I would highly recommend this course to another student. The course content is very, very interesting, and the professors teach well.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student, especially if they enjoy epigenetics and genetics in general! This course is great and you'll learn about epigenetics and its applications. A lot of the lectures cover current research in the field and results that have been found so far. However, please note that this isn't an easy class, so make sure not to take too heavy of a schedule with it. It is very conceptual and relies a lot more on understanding and applying concepts rather than route memorization. As long as you put in the work and effort into understanding the concepts, reaching out for help through office hours, attending lectures, and just enjoying the class then you'll do great!
